formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Let B = bust, W = waist, H = full hip, HH = high-hip, S = shoulders (all in the same unit). We compute: Inline ratios: WHR: $\\displaystyle \\mathrm{WHR} = \\frac{W}{H}$ Bust-to-Hip: $\\displaystyle \\mathrm{B/H} = \\frac{B}{H}$ Shoulder-to-Hip: $\\displaystyle \\mathrm{S/H} = \\frac{S}{H}$ Waist-to-Mean(B,H): $\\displaystyle W_m = \\frac{W}{\\frac{B+H}{2}}$ Classification rules (simplified from FFIT-inspired thresholds): Hourglass: $\\displaystyle \\bigg|\\frac{B-H}{\\max(B,H)}\\bigg| \\le 0.05\\ \\land\\ W_m \\le 0.75$ Top Hourglass: $\\displaystyle \\frac{B-H}{H} > 0.05\\ \\land\\ W_m \\le 0.75$ Bottom Hourglass: $\\displaystyle \\frac{H-B}{B} > 0.05\\ \\land\\ W_m \\le 0.75$ Spoon: $\\displaystyle H \\ge 1.09\\,B\\ \\land\\ (HH\\ \\text{given} \\Rightarrow H \\ge 1.05\\,HH)\\ \\land\\ \\mathrm{WHR} < 0.80$ Triangle (Pear): $\\displaystyle H - B \\ge 0.05\\,B$ (and not Hourglass/Spoon) Inverted Triangle: $\\displaystyle (B - H \\ge 0.05\\,H)\\ \\lor\\ (S - H \\ge 0.05\\,H)$ (and not Top Hourglass) Rectangle: $\\displaystyle \\bigg|\\frac{B-H}{\\max(B,H)}\\bigg| < 0.05\\ \\land\\ 0.75 < W_m \\le 0.85$ Round/Apple: $\\displaystyle \\mathrm{WHR} \\ge 0.85\\ \\land\\ \\frac{W}{B} \\ge 0.85$
